medical_history.chief_complaint: Transient congenital hypothyroidism (CH) detected during neonatal screening.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient was born at term and presented with elevated TSH and an enlarged thyroid gland at neonatal screening. At 14 days of age, the high serum TSH level persisted. Treatment with L-T4 was initiated, which normalized serum TSH levels. After 2 years on L-T4, TSH levels were seen to rise again post withdrawal, but the patient remained clinically euthyroid with stable free T4 concentrations.
medical_history.past_medical_history: No significant past medical conditions were mentioned in relation to the current case.
medical_history.family_history: Both parents had no goiters and normal thyroid function tests.
